title: Purplebricks not for sale despite parlous financial position
text:
THE head of struggling estate agent Purplebricks has insisted the business is not for sale and defended the company’s fixed-fee pricing model.

Vic Darvey took over from founder Michael Bruce in May as chief executive of the firm, a hybrid of online technology with local self-employed property agents.

Michael and brother Kenny sold their combined 14pc stake to Europe’s biggest publisher, Axel Springer, which now owns 27pc.

Purplebricks abandoned a disastrous overseas expansion into the US and Australia this year after spending tens of millions on marketing. Springer’s enlarged stake has sparked speculation of a takeover among industry rivals.

Mr Darvey told The Telegraph the company was “absolutely...
description: THE head of struggling estate agent Purplebricks has insisted the business is not for sale and defended the company’s fixed-fee pricing model.
